maml:description.maml:para: Connects to a DPA tenant
Connects to a DPA tenant to be able to run IdentityCommand.DPA module commands against it.
Requires prior authentication to the related ISPSS Identity Shared Services tenant using the `IdentityCommand` module.
The url of the DPA tenant
The url of the DPA tenant

dev:remarks.maml:para: Connects to the https://sometenant.dpa.cyberark.cloud DPA tenant for subsequent module operations

maml:description.maml:para: Get details of the current DPA session
Returns values of variables from the script scope of the IdentityCommand.DPA module.
This command can be used to examine details usually contained in the script scope of the module.
Useful data like the last command, last command results and session elapsed time are returned by the command.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns details relating to the module session from the script scope.

Creates new DPA policy using the details specified for any parameters
A name for the policy
The status of the policy
A description for the policy

Describes the configuration relating to the providers for the policy
The date the policy is valid from
The end date for the policy

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a draft policy with no settings
Creates an enabled policy, valid for 7 days with settings according to the parameter values.
`$providersData` object is created using the `New-DPAPolicyProviderDefinition` command
`$userAccessRules` object is created using the `New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition` command
Creates an enabled policy with settings according to the parameter values.
`$providersData` object is created using the `New-DPAPolicyProviderDefinition` command
`$userAccessRules` object is created using the `New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition` command
Creates a draft policy with settings according to the parameter values.
`$providersData` object is created using the `New-DPAPolicyProviderDefinition` command
Creates a draft policy with settings according to the parameter values.
`$userAccessRules` object is created using the `New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition` command

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$ConnectAs = New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition -OnPrem -assignGroups Administrators $ConnectAs = New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition -AWS -ssh "ec2-user" -assignGroups Administrators, "Remote Desktop Users" -connectAsDefinition $ConnectAs $ConnectAs = New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition -Azure -ssh "azureuser" -connectAsDefinition $ConnectAs $ConnectAs = New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition -GCP -ssh "root" -connectAsDefinition $ConnectAs
$UserData = New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition -Role -name "DEV_TEAM_ROLE" $UserData = New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition -Role -name "SOME_TEAM_ROLE" -UserDataDefinition $UserData $UserData = New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition -Group -name "DEV_TEAM_GROUP" -UserDataDefinition $UserData $UserData = New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition -Group -name "SOME_TEAM_GROUP" -UserDataDefinition $UserData $UserData = New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition -User -name SomeUser -UserDataDefinition $UserData $UserData = New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition -User -name SomeOtherUser -UserDataDefinition $UserData
$AccessRules = @() $AccessRules += New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition -ruleName SomeAccessRule -userData $UserData1 -connectAs $ConnectAs1 -timeZone Europe/London $AccessRules += New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition -ruleName AnotherAccessRule -userData $UserData2 -connectAs $ConnectAs2 -timeZone America/Costa_Rica
$FQDNrules = @() $FQDNrules += New-DPAPolicyFQDNRuleDefinition -operator EXACTLY -computernamePattern SomeHost -domain SomeDomain.com $FQDNrules += New-DPAPolicyFQDNRuleDefinition -operator WILDCARD -computernamePattern *-DEV-* -domain SomeDomain.com $FQDNrules += New-DPAPolicyFQDNRuleDefinition -operator SUFFIX -computernamePattern '-Prod' -domain SomeDomain.com $FQDNrules += New-DPAPolicyFQDNRuleDefinition -operator CONTAINS -computernamePattern SQL -domain SomeDomain.com $FQDNrules += New-DPAPolicyFQDNRuleDefinition -operator PREFIX -computernamePattern DC1 -domain SomeDomain.com
$Providers = New-DPAPolicyProviderDefinition -OnPrem -fqdnRulesConjunction OR -fqdnRules $FQDNrules $Providers = New-DPAPolicyProviderDefinition -AWS -regions "us-east-1","us-east-2" -tags @{"Key"="env";"Value"=@("prod")} -ProviderDefinition $Providers $Providers = New-DPAPolicyProviderDefinition -Azure -regions "eastus2","eastus" -tags @{"Key"="env";"Value"=@("prod")} -ProviderDefinition $Providers $Providers = New-DPAPolicyProviderDefinition -GCP -regions "asia-east1","us-east1" -labels @{"Key"="env";"Value"=@("prod")} -ProviderDefinition $Providers
New-DPAPolicy -policyName SomePolicy -status Enabled -description "Some Description" -providersData $Providers -userAccessRules $AccessRules

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a complete policy with settings according to the parameter values.

maml:description.maml:para: Define an object to describing ConnectAs configuration for a User Access Rule of a DPA Policy.
Outputs an object to be provided as input for the `connectAs` parameter of the `New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition` function.
The Connect As definition forms part of the User Access Rule defined on a DPA policy.
Specify to create a connectAs definition for AWS connections
Predefined assigned groups of the local ephemeral user on Windows Servers.
Add additional data to previous output from `New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition`.
Used to build a collection of connectAs definitions when multiple rules will be assigned in a policy.
For SSH connections, the local target user or a personal user template
Specify to create a connectAs definition for Azure connections
Predefined assigned groups of the local ephemeral user on Windows Servers.
Add additional data to previous output from `New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition`.
Used to build a collection of connectAs definitions when multiple rules will be assigned in a policy.
For SSH connections, the local target user or a personal user template
Specify to create a connectAs definition for GCP connections
Predefined assigned groups of the local ephemeral user on Windows Servers.
Add additional data to previous output from `New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition`.
Used to build a collection of connectAs definitions when multiple rules will be assigned in a policy.
For SSH connections, the local target user or a personal user template
Specify to create a connectAs definition for On-Premise connections
Predefined assigned groups of the local ephemeral user on Windows Servers.
Add additional data to previous output from `New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition`.
Used to build a collection of connectAs definitions when multiple rules will be assigned in a policy.
For SSH connections, the local target user or a personal user template
Specify to create a connectAs definition for AWS connections
Specify to create a connectAs definition for Azure connections
Specify to create a connectAs definition for GCP connections
Specify to create a connectAs definition for On-Premise connections
Predefined assigned groups of the local ephemeral user on Windows Servers.
Add additional data to previous output from `New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition`.
Used to build a collection of connectAs definitions when multiple rules will be assigned in a policy.
For SSH connections, the local target user or a personal user template

dev:remarks.maml:para: Defines a ConnectAs object which states users connecting via a DPA policy configured with the ConnectAs definition using RDP, will use ephemeral accounts which are added to the the Administrators group for On-Premise Windows servers.
The `$ConnectAs` variable in the above example is used as input for the `connectAs` parameter of the `New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition` function.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $ConnectAs = New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition -OnPrem -assignGroups Administrators $ConnectAs = New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition -AWS -ssh "ec2-user" -assignGroups Administrators, "Remote Desktop Users" -connectAsDefinition $ConnectAs $ConnectAs = New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition -Azure -ssh "azureuser" -connectAsDefinition $ConnectAs $ConnectAs = New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition -GCP -ssh "root" -connectAsDefinition $ConnectAs

dev:remarks.maml:para: Defines a ConnectAs object which states users connecting via a DPA policy configured with the ConnectAs definition: - Use ephemeral accounts added to the `Administrators` group for on-premise windows servers
- Use ephemeral accounts added to the `Administrators` & `Remote Desktop Users`group for AWS windows servers
- Connect as the `ec2-user` local target user for AWS linux servers
- Connect as the `azureuser` local target user for Azure linux servers
- Connect as the `root` local target user for GCP linux servers
The `$ConnectAs` variable in the above example is used as input for the `connectAs` parameter of the `New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition` function.

maml:description.maml:para: Defines FQDN rules for On-Prem provider rules asserted in a DPA policy.
Defines criteria based on FQDN rules specified in a DPA policy.
Target machines matching the criteria will be accessible via a policy containing the rule(s).
The object output by this function is used as input for the `fqdnRules` parameter of the `New-DPAPolicyProviderDefinition` function.
Operator to perform on the FQDN
The pattern to match in relations to the operator
The domain in which to execute the operator on the pattern
The pattern to match in relations to the operator
The domain in which to execute the operator on the pattern
Operator to perform on the FQDN

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates the definition of an FQDN rule to exactly match a virtual machine named SomeHost.SomeDomain.com
The `$FQDNrules` variable in the above example is used as input for the `fqdnRules` parameter of the `New-DPAPolicyProviderDefinition` function.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $FQDNrules = @() $FQDNrules += New-DPAPolicyFQDNRuleDefinition -operator EXACTLY -computernamePattern SomeHost -domain SomeDomain.com $FQDNrules += New-DPAPolicyFQDNRuleDefinition -operator WILDCARD -computernamePattern '*-DEV-*' -domain SomeDomain.com $FQDNrules += New-DPAPolicyFQDNRuleDefinition -operator SUFFIX -computernamePattern '-Prod' -domain SomeDomain.com $FQDNrules += New-DPAPolicyFQDNRuleDefinition -operator CONTAINS -computernamePattern SQL -domain SomeDomain.com $FQDNrules += New-DPAPolicyFQDNRuleDefinition -operator PREFIX -computernamePattern DC1 -domain SomeDomain.com

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a definition of FQDN rules to match virtual machines according to the parameter values specified.
The `$FQDNrules` variable in the above example is used as input for the `fqdnRules` parameter of the `New-DPAPolicyProviderDefinition` function.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an object defining Provider data for inclusion in a DPA policy.
Defines the data and criteria for providers supported in DPA.
Target machines matching the criteria will be accessible via a policy containing the definition.
The object output by this function is provided as input for the `providersData` parameter of the `New-DPAPolicy` function.
Specify to define an AWS provider object.
Add additional data to previous output from `New-DPAPolicyProviderDefinition`.
Used to create defninitions which cover multiple providers to be included in a single DPA policy.
AWS Account IDs.
Leave empty for all AWS Accounts.
AWS, Azure or GCP region names.
Leave empty for all regions.
A list of key/value pairs that have been defined as custom tags for Azure VMs or AWS instances.
Leave empty for all tags
A list of Azure VNet IDs.
Leave empty for all VNets.
Specify to define an Azure provider object.

Leave empty for all resource groups

Leave empty for all tags

maml:description.maml:para: Define User Access Rules for a DPA Policy
Creates user access rule definitions to provide as input when creating a new DPA policy with `New-DPAPolicy`
The access rule name.
Accepts object output from New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition.
Accepts object output from New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition.
The maximum time of the session in hours.
The maximum idle time before the session ends, in minutes.
Days of the week during which the policy will allow access.
Leave empty for all days.
Whether the policy will give access during the entire day.
If this is set to false, a timeframe is required in the hoursFrom and hoursTo parameters.
The time of day from which the policy will allow access.
Time format: hh:mm.
The time of day until which the policy will allow access.
Time format: hh:mm.
The timezone that is taken into account when calculating the hoursFrom and hoursTo parameters.
Represented by zone name such as "America/Los_Angeles" or "Australia/Sydney".
These names are defined by TZ database name.
Full list can be found in the following links: - https://www.iana.org/time-zones
- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones
Accepts object output from New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition.
Days of the week during which the policy will allow access.
Leave empty for all days.
Whether the policy will give access during the entire day.
If this is set to false, a timeframe is required in the hoursFrom and hoursTo parameters.
The maximum time of the session in hours.
The time of day from which the policy will allow access.
Time format: hh:mm.
The time of day until which the policy will allow access.
Time format: hh:mm.
The maximum idle time before the session ends, in minutes.
The access rule name.
The timezone that is taken into account when calculating the hoursFrom and hoursTo parameters.
Represented by zone name such as "America/Los_Angeles" or "Australia/Sydney".
These names are defined by TZ database name.
Full list can be found in the following links: - https://www.iana.org/time-zones
- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones
Accepts object output from New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Defines a new user access rule according to the specified parameters.
`$UserData` object is created using the `New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition` command
`$ConnectAs` object is created using the `New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition` command

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$AccessRules = @()
$AccessRules += New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition -ruleName SomeAccessRule -userData $UserData1 ` -connectAs $ConnectAs1 -grantAccess 1 -idleTime 10 -timeZone Europe/London -daysOfWeek Mon,Tue,Wed,Thu,Fri
$AccessRules += New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition -ruleName AnotherAccessRule -userData $UserData2 ` -connectAs $ConnectAs2 -grantAccess 1 -idleTime 10 -timeZone America/Costa_Rica -fullDays $false ` -hoursFrom 09:00 -hoursTo 18:00

dev:remarks.maml:para: Defines a set of user access rules according to the specified parameters.
`$UserData` object is created using the `New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition` command
`$ConnectAs` object is created using the `New-DPAPolicyConnectAsDefinition` command

maml:description.maml:para: Defines user data for the User Access Rule of a DPA policy.
Creates an object for inclusion as a user access rule of a DPA Policy.
This function is used to provide the object for the `userData` parameter when defining a User Access Rules using the `New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition` function.
The name of a group to include in the user data definition.
The specified groups define which users can access the assets defined in a DPA policy.
Adds additional data to previous output from `New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition`.
This is used when multiple users, groups and/or roles are required to be specified in an access rule.
The name of the user, group or role to include in the definition.
The source of the object to include in the rule.
If left blank, the source will be determined from the Identity Cloud Directory.
The name of a role to include in the user data definition.
The roles specified define which users can access the assets defined in a DPA policy.
Adds additional data to previous output from `New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition`.
This is used when multiple users, groups and/or roles are required to be specified in an access rule.
The name of the user, group or role to include in the definition.
The source of the object to include in the rule.
If left blank, the source will be determined from the Identity Cloud Directory.
The name of a user to include in the user data definition.
The users specifed can access the assets defined in a DPA policy.
A user's login name should be specified as it appears in CyberArk Identity Cloud Directory (login_name@suffix).
Adds additional data to previous output from `New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition`.
This is used when multiple users, groups and/or roles are required to be specified in an access rule.
The name of the user, group or role to include in the definition.
The source of the object to include in the rule.
If left blank, the source will be determined from the Identity Cloud Directory.
The name of a group to include in the user data definition.
The specified groups define which users can access the assets defined in a DPA policy.
The name of a role to include in the user data definition.
The roles specified define which users can access the assets defined in a DPA policy.
The name of a user to include in the user data definition.
The users specifed can access the assets defined in a DPA policy.
A user's login name should be specified as it appears in CyberArk Identity Cloud Directory (login_name@suffix).
Adds additional data to previous output from `New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition`.
This is used when multiple users, groups and/or roles are required to be specified in an access rule.
The name of the user, group or role to include in the definition.
The source of the object to include in the rule.
If left blank, the source will be determined from the Identity Cloud Directory.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a user data definition for the "DEV_TEAM_ROLE" Identity Role.
The `$UserData` variable in the above example is used as input for the `userData` parameter of the `New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition` function.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $UserData = New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition -Role -name "DEV_TEAM_ROLE" $UserData = New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition -Role -name "SOME_TEAM_ROLE" -UserDataDefinition $UserData $UserData = New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition -Group -name "DEV_TEAM_GROUP" -UserDataDefinition $UserData $UserData = New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition -Group -name "SOME_TEAM_GROUP" -UserDataDefinition $UserData $UserData = New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition -User -name SomeUser -UserDataDefinition $UserData $UserData = New-DPAPolicyUserDataDefinition -User -name SomeOtherUser -UserDataDefinition $UserData

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a user data definition for the Roles groups and users specified.
The `$UserData` variable in the above example is used as input for the `userData` parameter of the `New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition` function.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new strong account configuration in DPA

Configures a new strong account in DPA for use against either a virtual machine or database. Strong account can be an account already vaulted in Privilege Cloud, or can be stored locally in the DPA service.

A certificate filename for the account

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set DPA Policy with ID 1234-abcd to "Enabled"
Set DPA Policy with ID 1234-abcd to be valid for the next 7 days
Update DPA Policy with ID 1234-abcd with provider configuration held in the $ProviderData object. ProviderData object is created with the New-DPAPolicyProviderDefinition function.
Update DPA Policy with ID 1234-abcd with access rule configuration held in the $AccessRules object. ProviderData object is created with the New-DPAPolicyUserAccessRuleDefinition function.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates DPA settings
Enable, disable, or set values for DPA settings.
Switch parameter to interface with settings related to databases
Specify if client IP is enforced
Specify if MFA caching is enabled
Specify MFA caching key expiration
Specify the number of times an MFA caching token can be used
Switch parameter to interface with settings related to standing access for databases
Specify if fingerprint validation is enabled
Specify if RDP standing access is enabled and available
Specify session idle time
Specify maximum session duration
Specify if SSH standing access if available
Switch parameter to interface with settings related to standing access
Specify if standing access is enabled and available
Switch parameter to interface with settings related to certificate validation
Specify if setting is enabled or disabled
Specify if client IP is enforced
Specify if MFA caching is enabled
Specify MFA caching key expiration

Specify the number of times an MFA caching token can be used
Specify if client IP is enforced

Specify the number of times an MFA caching token can be used
Specify if setting is enabled or disabled
Specify if file transfer over rdp is enabled or not
Specify if setting is enabled or disabled

Specify if command parsing is enabled
Specify SSH prompt for audit capability

dev:remarks.maml:para: Enables SSH MFA Caching and sets timeout for 7200 seconds
Disables RDP recording
Enables RDP file transfer
